entries.label: TypeScript
entries.description: A strongly typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript. Essential for large-scale applications with improved tooling and maintainability.

entries.label: Vue
entries.description: Progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. Approachable, versatile, and performant with excellent developer experience.

entries.label: NUXT
entries.description: Meta-framework for Vue.js that provides server-side rendering, static site generation, and powerful routing out of the box.

entries.label: Go
entries.description: Statically typed, compiled language designed for simplicity and efficiency. Excellent for building microservices and cloud-native applications.

entries.label: Rust
entries.description: Systems programming language focused on safety, concurrency, and performance. Steep learning curve but valuable for performance-critical applications.

entries.label: Domain-Driven Design
entries.description: Strategic approach to software design that focuses on modeling complex business domains. Essential for building maintainable enterprise systems.

entries.label: Event Sourcing
entries.description: Pattern where state changes are stored as a sequence of events. Provides complete audit trail and enables temporal queries.

entries.label: CQRS
entries.description: Command Query Responsibility Segregation separates read and write models. Useful for complex domains with different read/write patterns.

entries.label: Microservices
entries.description: Architectural pattern that structures applications as loosely coupled services. Enables independent deployment and scaling.

entries.label: Test-Driven Development
entries.description: Development approach where tests are written before implementation. Improves code quality and design through rapid feedback.

entries.label: Trunk-Based Development
entries.description: Source control branching model where developers work on a single branch with short-lived feature branches. Enables continuous integration.

entries.label: AWS
entries.description: Leading cloud platform with comprehensive suite of services. Industry standard with mature tooling and extensive documentation.

entries.label: Kubernetes
entries.description: Container orchestration platform for automating deployment, scaling, and management. Powerful but complex; ensure you need it before adopting.

entries.label: VS Code
entries.description: Lightweight but powerful code editor with excellent extension ecosystem. Great balance of features and performance.

entries.label: Terraform
entries.description: Infrastructure as code tool for provisioning cloud resources. Declarative approach with good multi-cloud support.

entries.label: MySQL
entries.description: Open-source relational database management system. Reliable, widely supported, and excellent for most applications.

entries.label: Redis
entries.description: In-memory data store used for caching, message queuing, and real-time analytics. Fast and versatile.

entries.label: Memcached
entries.description: High-performance, distributed memory caching system. Simple and fast but limited compared to Redis.
